title: Amazon Linux 2 2017.12 - ALAS2-2020-1536: medium priority package update for mailman
description:
Package updates are available for Amazon Linux 2 that fix the following vulnerabilities:
CVE-2018-13796:
	An issue was discovered in GNU Mailman before 2.1.28. A crafted URL can cause arbitrary text to be displayed on a web page from a trusted site.
1609090: CVE-2018-13796 mailman: Mishandled URLs in Utils.py:GetPathPieces() allows attackers to display arbitrary text on trusted sites

CVE-2018-0618:
	A cross-site scripting vulnerability (XSS) has been discovered in mailman due to the host_name field not being properly validated. A malicious list owner could use this flaw to create a specially crafted list and inject client-side scripts.
1596458: CVE-2018-0618 mailman: Cross-site scripting vulnerability allows malicious listowners to inject scripts into listinfo pages
